titles.title: Providing for the consideration of the bill (H.R. 1845) to establish the Biological Survey in the Department of the Interior.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 103-262, by Mr. Hall (OH).

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 1845 with 1 hour of general debate. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions except motion to recommit with or without instructions. In lieu of the committee amendments now printed in the bill, it shall be in order to consider as an original bill for the purpose of amendment under the five-minute rule the amendment in the nature of a substitute printed in the report of the Committee on Rules accompanying this resolution. Measure will be read by section. Bill is open to amendments.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 92.

action.text: MODIFICATION OF TEXT OF H. RES. 262 - Mr. Hall of Ohio asked unanimous consent that the text of H. Res. 262 be modified to reflect correction of a drafting error that inadvertantly allocated one hour of general debate on H.R. 1845 when the intent of the Committee on Rules had been to allocate one hour and fifteen minutes of general debate. Agreed to without objection.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate.
The previous question was ordered without objection.

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 238 - 188 (Roll no. 483).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 9/28/1993--Introduced. Sets forth the rule for the consideration of H.R. 1845 (establishment of the Biological Survey in the Department of the Interior).
